intro: Chaetostoma glaziovii var. rubellum, commonly known as the red-stemmed velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and distinctive red or purple stems. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, adding visual interest to gardens.
